page.title: 07GELSTON SCHOOL
page.content: The present school was built in 1931-2 and consists of two classrooms, staff-room, toilets and a storage cupboard. Meals are prepared and served in the building which was the old school, and the dining-room is also used as a general purposes room. There are thirty three children on the roll and two teachers. There are visiting teachers of art, physical education and music, and chldren have the opportunity to learn to play the violin. The children participate in a number of extra-curricular activities, such as swimming, sailing and orienteering. This year a store-room is to be added to the school, and with the roll next session expected to be forty, the school's future would seem to be assured.
